Chat

Class Checkers.Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Chat.Checkers.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChatDisplay, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Enclosing class:
    Checkers

    public static class Checkers.Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, ChatDisplay, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    This panel displays a 160-by-160 checkerboard pattern with a 2-pixel black border. It is assumed that the size of the panel is set to exactly 164-by-164 pixels. This class does the work of letting the users play checkers, and it displays the checkerboard.
    Version:
    May 25, 2015
    Author:
    Jessica, Nanxi, Prachi, Period: 2, Assignment: CHECKERS, Sources: David Eck
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • chatMessage

        public void chatMessage(SocketName name,
               java.lang.String message)
        This method receives messages sent from the other player and calls the appropriate methods. If the message is "doNewGame," the doNewGame method is called; if the message is "doResign," the doResign method is called. If the message is row/column coordinates, the string is parsed to obtain the coordinates that are entered into the doClickSquare method's parameters. If the message does not meet any of those criteria, an error message is generated.
        Specified by:
        chatMessage in interface ChatDisplay
        Parameters:
        name - The socket the message came from
        message - The chat message received
        See Also:
        ChatDisplay.chatMessage(Chat.SocketName, java.lang.String)

      • doClickSquare

        public void doClickSquare(int row,
                 int col,
                 boolean local)
        This is called by mousePressed() when a player clicks on the square in the specified row and col. It has already been checked that a game is, in fact, in progress.
        Parameters:
        row - The row position clicked on
        col - The col position clicked on
        local - If it's currently the user's turn

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draw a checkerboard pattern in gray and lightGray. Draw the checkers. If a game is in progress, hilite the legal moves.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object
        See Also:
        JComponent.paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Respond to a user click on the board. If no game is in progress, show an error message. Otherwise, find the row and column that the user clicked and call doClickSquare() to handle it.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        evt - The event generated by the mouse
        See Also:
        MouseListener.mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent)

      • statusMessage

        public void statusMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Display a received chat message. The socket where the message originated is provided in case you wish to display that information with the message.
        Specified by:
        statusMessage in interface ChatDisplay
        Parameters:
        message - The chat message received

      • createSocket

        public void createSocket(SocketName name)
        Description copied from interface: ChatDisplay
        Note the creation of a new socket and display it to the user. This allows the user to see which sockets are currently connected and (possibly) disconnect them.
        Specified by:
        createSocket in interface ChatDisplay
        Parameters:
        name - The socket that was just created
        See Also:
        ChatDisplay.createSocket(Chat.SocketName)

        Specified by:

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        KeyEvent handler method, used to deal with keyboard input on components that have registered with this class. For the most part, this method listens for the "return" key to be hit, checks which form element generated the event, and takes the appropriate action (creating a new message or connection).
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event to handle

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Event handling method required by the KeyEvent interface. This method is empty, as we don't deal with key release events at all.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - The key released event (ignored)
